reviews.text: I would give this hotel an average rating. The rooms are a bit dated and the furniture was worn. I think we stayed in the Belle room. There was a little cooktop stove and mini fridge in the room. I would have liked for there to be tile floors. Carpet in a beach town just doesn't seem sanitary to me. When we got our room there were no towels so we had to request them. The hallways and common areas are narrow, but they do provide 2 plastic chairs outside your door. The elevator is extemely slow and hot! The pool area was crowded too with the loungers all around. They do provide pool towels. The curtains in the room do not provide any sort of darkness. Hard to sleep in with the blarring sun shining through. The beach is right across the street. Like all of Wildwood, the beach is very wide, but there are wood platforms about halfway to the ocean to make it easier to walk. The southern begining of the boardwalk is about a block or two away. The rooftop deck is nice with hammocks to relax on. They should put a little bar up there. We had breakfast in the cafe and the pancakes were huge! Don't have high expectations for this hotel or any hotel in the area and it will be fine, although it is crazy what they charge per night for the Jersey Shore!
reviews.title: Par for the area

reviews.text: We've stayed here a number of times in the past and had a decent time. Not anymore. This last stay (almost a week) showed that the owners just have stopped caring. Rooms were not ready on time and FULL of broken items, many of which were never fixed. Missing a number of vertical blind slats on the balconly. Which, by-the-way has a blinding light that you can't turn off. Two overhead lights burned out and never replaced. Horrible beds that make sleeping almost impossible, and parking spaces so small you can't fit anything larger than a sedan. Clearly not worth the price.
reviews.title: Terribly dated, no attention to detail, no response to guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kicker and what made me write this is that it is 4pm and they STILL haven't made up our room for the day.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Awful
reviews.title: Kinda grows on you...but don't expect much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well let's see...Got to the hotel and at first we were like ok this might be nice. Got to the room and was like HERE WE GO... Stains on the walls, soiled carpets, AC that almost cooled the room down....At night we went to take showers and the drain was plugged up. Nothing like taking a shower in a puddle of backed up drain water. Got through that and went to lay down on the bed that i'm pretty sure a mason made from the hardest material he could find..Hard to fall asleep when your sleeping on bricks. Next morning we went to grab towels and a beach umbrella at the pool and the guy running the pool area told me how everything is messed up around here. I said should we sign out the stuff we're borrowing and he told me "nah don't worry i'm dealing with a hangover today" REAL PROFESSIONAL! THIS IS A FAR CRY FROM A RESORT!!!!
reviews.title: Nice, clean, but some little problems..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are picky, but we understand, like most people going to Wildwood, that hotel rooms in that area tend to be somewhat out of date and don't offer the comforts of a resort of similar cost elsewhere in the U.S. We decided to try out the Aqua Beach this year and were pleasantly surprised with our room. It was freshly painted, the beds were comfortable,the furniture was nice, and the kitchenette was newer and very clean. The bathroom was incredibly tiny and could have used some updating to match the rest of the room, but it was clean. Aqua Beach offers a closet with beach equipment like umbrellas, chairs and boogie boards which is really helpful if your umbrella breaks. Their pool was kept clean, which is tough when you have a lot of people using it on a hot weekend (if you're not a big fan of kids splashing around you might want to avoid the pool). They also have grills and covered outdoor seating for cooking on site. And the rooftop deck is really nice, especially at night. Lots of hammocks, lounge chairs and potted palms under pergolas. Maybe could use a little more shade is all. My only advice would be that if you like quiet during the day as well as at night, choose a room that isn't facing the pool. I chose a room that faced the parking lot with a beach view and I was glad I did. We were pleasantly surprised by the Aqua Beach and will definitely go back again. It's not the Taj Mahal but when it comes to Wildwood motels it's one of the best I've stayed in.
reviews.title: A very nice stay

reviews.text: We just stayed at the Aqua Beach and were not impressed. First of all it is not a resort it's a motel. The location is great as it is at the end of the boardwalk and across from the beach. The room was in serious need of remodeling but the linens and bathroom were clean. All of the hallways and elevators were dirty, the

The pool has the potential to be nice but the water was always cloudy. Definitely not worth the price. If you're going to Wildwood rent a condo they look better than most of the motels around.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!
Great location but "resort" is quite a stretch!
reviews.text: The Aqua Beach Resort is very nice! We stayed in the Largo room, second floor and it was perfect! Great view of the beach & loved to see the action with the bicyclers, joggers, walkers going by all day long! Just steps from the boardwalk, it was the perfect location. Last yr we stayed farther down the crest, and i loved this location better!
The hotel was very clean as well as the pool & hot tub!
reviews.title: It look good from far, but far from good!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: let me just say that we love the aqua beach!! we had the largo room and it was great. there was a very comfy king size bed and a flat tv, the bathroom was nice and big and we had a full kitchen as well. the pool area is very nice, and we were able to walk to the boardwalk and avoid the $20 parking. this is a very nice hotel and it seems lke they are re doing rooms each year. the prices are fair and the packages are good also.
reviews.title: loved our room, great place to stay

reviews.text: This is not a criticism really, it is simply a fact. If you travel to Wildwood Crest don't expect to be languishing in your room. If you want to simply go somewhere and stay in a room, there are other less expensive options (ie. Best Western)
reviews.title: The beach made the hotel

reviews.text: This is not really a "resort". It is a motel or hotel with a swimming pool that sits directly across from the Atlantic Ocean.
reviews.title: Business Group - Very Pleased
Nice room, good location… but the term "resort" is a bit of a stretch!
reviews.text: The room we stayed in (June 30th to July 2nd) is called the Palms. It is nice, but I would hardly call what they did a complete renovation.....if it was a complete renovation then they got ripped off.....the bathroom had old fixtures in it, not to mention the tile was from the 1970s. It did have a cute kitchenette, and a couple of small flat screens in each room, but still it is hard to say that this place is a "resort".

That said, the staff were nice. Got us extra towels & pillows. I would have liked to have a 'do not disturb' sign for the door, that way, if we did not want staff entering when we were there, or not, they would not. Also, a small room safe would be a good addition. And perhaps a small binder in each room to let people know what is in the area.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel In Wildwood!!!

reviews.text: The moment my family entered the Aqua Beach Hotel we felt as if we arrived at a Carribean Resort. Our room was immaculate and had a georgeous view of the ocean. The highlight of our stay was definitely the amazing pool. The temperature was perfect and the kiddie pool for my son was great. To make it even better the resort even had pool toys for the kids and adults. As a former employee in the service industry I was very impressed with the friendly staff. Thank you very much Aqua Beach for another wonderful experience!!
reviews.title: Amazing Vacation.... Location..... Hotel of Perfection

reviews.text: A group of us went down and we got 3 separate hotel rooms. The rooms were an average size. The room we had, had a king bed but it had the worst mattress ever. You could feel the springs in it! The TV was not a flat screen and really tiny but it was nice that it had smart sound. The bathroom had a huge soaking tub but i dont think I would ever use it given the fact that the room in general did not look that clean. The sink had no counter space for you items so that was kinda annoying. Our toilet paper holder was 1 tile length above the floor behind the toilet so it was hard to reach everytime and the toilet paper was the really really crappy stuff. I wish i had brought my own. Our toilet barely flushed, you had to stand there and hold the lever down until it was complete. Our room was on the first floor next to the pool. The shades didnt block out the lights at night so it was very hard to sleep.
reviews.title: its good if you get the right room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw our friend room and they had a great king bed with an awesome mattress that had a pillow top to it. Their toilet functioned properly and they had good toilet paper and it wasn't hidden behind the toilet! They had a larger TV that wasn't a flat screen but it was one of the models just before the flat screen came out. The other room in our group had a flat screen but it was an ocean front room. The restaurant in the hotel is really good for breakfast. Reasonable prices and the food was also good. The hotel is right next to the board walk so it makes it really convenient when walking to and from the boardwalk. I would probably check out some other hotels before returning to this one. It was kind of expensive for the quality.
reviews.title: Even under a crush of rudeness the Aqua Beach delivers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I have been staying at the AB for years now. Normally we go for the less crowded weekends to hit the Wildwood beaches, but this year our vacation fell on Memorial Day weekend. If you've ever been to the NJ shore on a major holiday you know what I mean.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.text: To say check-in was a mob scene is an understatement, but the AB staff behaved in a calm professional manner, even when people were obviously baiting them to get a reaction out of them. Our room was spotless, the housekeeping staff had no problem with our requests (extra pillows & towels) and when my husband couldn't get the AC to make the room like a meat locker the staff even replaced the unit (even though it was working just fine). Once again the AB made our vacation a memorable one.
reviews.title: Awesome! First chance we can, we're coming back!
